This subsidy corresponds to dependent workers who are in a situation of partial suspension of activities and within the framework of Law 19,972 and MTSS resolution No. 208 , of August 31, 2021.    Monthly workers, day laborers and with mixed remuneration who have a reduction of at least six full days of work and a maximum of 19 in the month or the reduction of the working day of at least 50% of the usual schedule will be entitled to the subsidy. Also, piecework workers or those with commission-type remuneration with a partial reduction of 50% or more in their average income (of the immediately preceding six months).    The reduction must occur during the validity of the ministerial resolutions, protection is currently foreseen until June 30, 2022.    Right to receive  The method of calculation that applies from September 2020 is described below.    Monthly and mixed-paid workers  The subsidy to be received will be up to 25% of the monthly average of the computable nominal remuneration received in the six full months of effective work prior to the cause being configured, depending on the number of days of suspension or reduction.    As of the month of April, the amount to be received, which includes the subsidy and what is paid by the company for the period actually worked, will in no case be less than 75% of the average monthly remuneration of the last six months taken for the benefit calculation.     day laborers  The subsidy to be received will be an average wage for each day not worked. The average wage is calculated by dividing by 150 the total remuneration received in the last six full months of effective work.    In all cases, the amount to be received will not exceed 12 wages and the wages worked plus the wages in subsidy will not exceed the monthly average of the last six months taken to calculate the benefit.    Pieceworkers and commission-type remuneration   The subsidy to be received will be the equivalent of the difference between 75% of the monthly average of the last six full months of effective work and that paid by the employer in said period, which may not be less than 25% of the monthly average.      To take into account:  in all cases, the employer will pay for what was actually worked.    Limits for the payment of the subsidy  Maximum cap: $50,973.34 (January 2022).    Minimum cap: $6,369.95 (January 2022).    https://web.archive.org/web/20220718125102/https://www.bps.gub.uy/16874/subsidio-especial-por-desempleo-parcial.html

On March 24th, 2022, President Maduro announced all schools would be open for in-person clasess with no limit of students per class. Students are required to use face masks, but no social distancing seems to be enforced. Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20220620130358/https://www.vtv.gob.ve/presidente-maduro-saluda-retorno-ninos-ninas-jovenes-clases-presenciales/

On January 4th, 2022, President Maduro announced that, until further notice, the partial lockdown measures (7 days of lockdown followed by 7 days of free movement) would be completed lifted. This has not changed during 2022. Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20220620132015/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iMEG0HpcMOU

There are no restrictions for public events. Large musical concerts and plays are being held in Venezuela's main cities. A fair amount of musical concerts are set to take place during the secod semester of 2022. Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20220620133931/https://puntodecorte.net/conciertos-confirmados-venezuela-semestre/
There are no restrictions on gatherings of any size.
There are no restrictions for the use of public transport. Users should use their facemasks, though enforcement is weak.

Starting on May 30th, 2022, Venezuela imposed new provisions for entry into the country, including: (1) vaccination certificate with the last registered vaccine between 15 days and 269 days prior to entry into the country; or a negative PCR-RT test of no more than 72 hours before arrival; (2) a PCR-RT will be carried out upon arrival at the airport in Venezuela (all children under 5 years old are excluded). Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20220620135101/https://www.vtv.gob.ve/nuevas-medidas-prevencion-covid19-vuelos-venezuela/

Maduro tends to hand out bonuses to retired people and pensioners and the population enrolled in the "Sistema Patria" (electronic registry used for political control and mobilization). Though some bonuses had been paid-out under the framework of economic support against the pandemic, the bonuses to be hand out in July are not aimed to assist economic losses generated by the pandemic, but to randomly reward Venezuelans registered in the "Sistema Patria". Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20220711120620/https://eldiario.com/2022/07/01/bonos-sistema-patria-mes-de-julio/

The Health Ministry's web page is regularly updated in regards to the COVID-19 pandemic (including, among others, statistics, general information and recomendations). Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20220620145050/http://www.mpps.gob.ve/index.php    The governments COVID-19 blog is regularly updated. PCR-RT is rarely available in public health buildings. In turn, PCR-RT is fully available in private laboratories for those that can pay up to USD 100 per test. This limits the efective access to testing. This has been a constant during 2022. Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20220620150746/https://www.efe.com/efe/america/sociedad/pruebas-de-covid-19-en-venezuela-un-lujo-al-que-muchos-no-pueden-acceder/20000013-4728037
Their doesn't seem to be a government policy on contact tracing after a positive diagnosis.

Though the use of the facemask is mandatory outside the home, Venezuelans are using it less and less. The enforcement is weak. Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20220524043212/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/venezuela/coronavirus

Every Venezuelan has access to vaccination (starting at 2 years of age). The Health Ministry has a list of public vaccination centers; and a few chain of private pharmacies also carry the vaccine. Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20220620152404/https://sites.google.com/view/centros-de-vacunacion-covid/inicio    Vaccines being administered are: Sinopharm, Sinovac, Sputnik V and Abdala. Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20220620162419/https://talcualdigital.com/covid-19-pierde-terreno-en-una-venezuela-que-busca-la-recuperacion-economica/
